page.title: 07 St. Cleer Well.
page.content:
Our Well is in Well Lane, to the North of the Church. It looks like a very small granite chapel. It has a wall at the back with two decorative arches, and two big arches on the other sides. The roof is made out of slabs of granite with pinnacles at each corner, from which the points have been broken off. There is a small statue above the front arches of St. Clarus, who was a 10th century bishop. At the front of the roof there is a granite cross. There is a grid to stop people falling in the water.
This well was a bowsening well, which was supposed to cure the mad, blind, lame and epileptics. People throw money in the well to give them good luck. The money is collected each year to help maintain the well. It is the only endowed well in the world.
